ray.renderer

Class DirectOnlyRenderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ray.renderer.DirectOnlyRenderer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Renderer
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DirectOnlyMediumRenderer, PathTracer

    public class DirectOnlyRenderer
extends java.lang.Object
implements Renderer
    A renderer that computes radiance due to emitted and directly reflected light only.
    Author:
    cxz (at Columbia)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DirectOnlyRenderer()
      The default is to compute using uninformed sampling w.r.t.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void emittedRadiance(IntersectionRecord iRec, Vector3 dir, Color outColor)
      Compute the radiance emitted by a surface.
      void rayRadiance(Scene scene, Ray ray, SampleGenerator sampler, int sampleIndex, Color outColor)
      Evaluates the direct illumination component (first-order component) of a radiance arriving to the camera along the given Ray.
      void setDirectIlluminator(DirectIlluminator direct)
      This allows the rendering algorithm to be selected from the input file by substituting an instance of a different class of DirectIlluminator.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • DirectOnlyRenderer

        public DirectOnlyRenderer()
        The default is to compute using uninformed sampling w.r.t. projected solid angle over the hemisphere.

    • Method Detail

      • setDirectIlluminator

        public void setDirectIlluminator(DirectIlluminator direct)
        This allows the rendering algorithm to be selected from the input file by substituting an instance of a different class of DirectIlluminator.
        Parameters:
        direct - the object that will be used to compute direct illumination

      • rayRadiance

        public void rayRadiance(Scene scene,
                        Ray ray,
                        SampleGenerator sampler,
                        int sampleIndex,
                        Color outColor)
        Evaluates the direct illumination component (first-order component) of a radiance arriving to the camera along the given Ray.
        Specified by:
        rayRadiance in interface Renderer
        Parameters:
        scene - Scene to be rendered
        ray - the camera ray along which we compute the radiance
        sampler - The sampler is used to generate random numbers for sampling rays
        sampleIndex - index of the currently sampled ray in a pixel. The index value will be used in SampleGenerator.sample(int, int, Point2) method.
        outColor - output radiance for each RGB channel

      • emittedRadiance

        protected void emittedRadiance(IntersectionRecord iRec,
                               Vector3 dir,
                               Color outColor)
        Compute the radiance emitted by a surface.
        Parameters:
        iRec - Information about the surface point being shaded
        dir - The exitant direction (surface coordinates)
        outColor - The emitted radiance is written to this color
